name: Hotel Amsterdam - De Roode Leeuw

reviews.text: I stayed here for 7 nights on a business trip and I have to say this hotel made an otherwise awful trip a more bearable one! Like some people have said, the rooms are small but ideal for one person. They are very clean and serviced everyday. I made good use of my room whilst staying here, the room enabled me to have some ‘me’ time during a very long tradeshow in the city. (the shower was amazing!) The room had a very well stocked mini bar and a room service menu which again I made good use of. The food arrived with 15 minutes and it was lovely! The food in the restaurant of the hotel was again really lovely and quite reasonably priced. I heard a few people in my party complain about the breakfast, powdery scrambled eggs, no fried eggs etc. I however thought the breakfast was great, selection of hot and cold to suit everyone. Lastly I have to say the staff where brilliant, very friendly and willing to do anything.
reviews.title: Location doesn't get any better than this!

likes.liked: — Room service, well stocked mini bar, great shower, comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — The fact that I was there for work!

reviews.text: Location wise, it doesn’t get any better than this, it’s located right on the edge of Dam Square, there’s a tram stop literally outside the hotel and all the bars and restaurants you could ever wish for!
reviews.title: Top floor at the Amsterdam

reviews.text: All in all, I thought the hotel was brilliant and will go back there for a personal trip sometime next year.
reviews.title: In the Heart of the City

likes.disliked: — No apology for inconveniece cuased by a broken lock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of a barge tour coming from Brugge. We were early and could not get into our room for hours, some members of the group waited till 4 o'clock. Not all rooms are non-smoking which was part of the holdup. We were lucky and got one of the 2 rooftop rooms, view of sky (and air conditioners) though it was up 13 steep steps. It was very roomy and had a very large bathroom, newly redone ....but it did have the odd hair dryer. It was very clean, and very quiet "up there".
reviews.title: great food

reviews.text: The location was wonderful, breakfast was good, the staff was pleasant and helpful. It was great to be in such a central location.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: The room was clean - we requested two single beds and they were pushed together with very little room to separate them. The location was awesome, right new the Jordaan and the red light district. easy walking distance to Central Station for metros and water taxis. The sign at the front desk indicated that anyone caught using drugs onthe premises would be prosecuted immediately and the police would be called. I thought that was interesting. The hair dryer in the room was definitely from the 1950s - you had to be a little on the tall side to manage it since it was a hose that came out of a box on the wall. To activate it, you had to manually lift up the end of the hose that attached to the wall. A little funky but it worked, slowly.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: All in all, cool place to stay because of the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!
reviews.title: great location, but exensive weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: about 10 minutes walk from the station, which is the best way to get from the airport and much much cheaper, go out of the station and its straight down the damrak on your right hand side, u can check in your bags but not check in till 3pm, check out is 11am. quite freindly staff, the rooms are small, ours had a good back street veiw, but our freinds got a wall and their room was double booked and were walked in on whilst in bed, no apology was given by staff! we had a good shower, but very small bathroom with no bath, but our freinds did have a bath. we got a double bed with 2 single mattresses! who likes to slip down the gap??? not me. there was a mini bar, but we dare not touch it for fear of crazy prices. breakfast was 8-10 not worth the bother, scrammbled egg, bacon, make your own toast, ceral, croissants, bannana, apple or yogurt , not imprerssive at all ...slow service for tea and coffee and wanted to charge me for decaff coffee 2 euro. i must say the luggage was well cared for before and after check out. theres a free safe in your room, but the wardrobe space is redicoulously small. the aircon/heating is either too hot or too cold too. tv was mostly english but expensive for adult channels. now about amsterdam : its large with impressive buildings, lots of bikes, trams and ppl. u must go to the rembrant museum its excellent at 10 euro each, near to vondel park which is worth a walk through. a round of 4 drinks can cost u between 15 to 25 euro so beware, nearer to damm square or redlight district u are the more expensive they are. it was really quite chilly and rained for half the time we were there ....u really do need good walking legs and comfy shoes i cant stress this enough. we went on a canal trip, its ok but not much exciting info given on it, oh what lovely gable ends! LOL
reviews.title: Small, adequate but dodgy en suite, great location though.
Good Location - Not Great Value!
reviews.text: the red light area is ok on the main streets but very seedy on the side streets, its whatever u prefer to be honest. many sex clubs at 25 euro each but they are hard core and apprentley look like they are bored doing the deed, so i hear. the sex shops are excellent and not at all embarrissing, theres lots of bars cafes etc, but the mcdonalds have bad service. most toilets are down steep staricases, be careful after having a skinful, and u gotta pay between 20 to 50 cents for the priveldge, even in mcdonalds.
get to the airport early as its very big and the gates are quite a good walking distance......btw : i never saw a windmill ...
reviews.title: Good Location, small rooms

reviews.text: We were here for 4 nights as part of a group tour, but our time here was mainly on our own. Yes, the rooms are small, and the streets outside are uncomfortably crowded.
reviews.title: Most helpful staff we've found in large hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But most rooms in central cities are small and this was esp. well thought-out and clean. The bathroom was full size. The hotel is just steps from the "Dam," the center of the city, so a perfect spot for sightseeing. Also, perfect for catching the train for a day of birdwatching in the Oostvaarderplassen with Flevo Birdwatching.
reviews.title: couldnt be more central

reviews.text: The dining room is very nice and the breakfasts were esp. enjoyable.
reviews.title: The smallest room ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the best part was the staff, who spoke perfect English and could not have been more helpful.
reviews.title: Rooms are So Small! Stay Somewhere Else.....

reviews.text: brilliant hotel great location everything within walking distance. rooms a bit on the small side but who stays in the room all day anyway. my husband doesnt like quilts but he was impressed by the ones here. he also said the pillows were the most comfortable hes ever had in a hotel. breakfast was brilliant, didnt need to eat lunch. staff were helpful and polite. the only negative were the toilet rolls, bit on the hard side. do go to gauchos argentinian steakhouse on damraat, best steak ever, the chicken was good too. also find your way to the hard rock cafe, near leidseplein wonderful food, lovely staff and if you like rock music you cant beat it. another good trip is the heineken museum.
reviews.title: Small but convenient
great hotel
reviews.text: Just got back from spending wedding anniversary/christmas. Had 2 flights cancelled so arrived at hotel a day late...fantastic staff couldn't have helped more. We extended a night and they didn't charged for the missed night. Also upgraded us to a suite and placed flowers in the room .

reviews.title: Fab hotel in heart of Amsterdam!
reviews.text: Very clean room, great minibar regularly stocked. We enjoyed the breakfast.
We stay in the Dam 3-4 times a year and would definately stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: not so good

reviews.text: Great location too.
reviews.title: luvly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a long weekend at the Roode Leeuw in Amsterdam to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday. Got a really good deal inlcuding breakfast and I sent the hotel an email asking for a nice quiet, non smoking room, preferably with a nice view as it was for my boyfriend's 40th and they went further than that and upgraded us to a junior suite which was fantastic. We had a balcony that overlooked Damrak and we could even see quite a bit of Dam Square as well. Everything looked very festive and the room was huge!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

likes.liked: — Everything - fantastic location and rooms and great staff
likes.disliked: — Nothing to comment - all a great experience

description: Great central location, affordable rates, clean & comfortable rooms and friendly & attentive hospitality. In an amazing location, just off Dam Square and right in the middle of Amsterdam's city center, you'll find Hotel Amsterdam De Roode Leeuw. This is where you want to stay if you're coming to Amsterdam. Sure, you can find fancier 4 star hotels in Amsterdam, but what we may lack in glitz we more than make up for in authentic friendliness and true hospitality. All of our bathrooms are all new, and our rooms are comfortable, well maintained, and always spotlessly clean.
